string.text: Ha! Up theirs! Thanks for the rescue, if you didn't show up, I'd already be the main course for those creatures. Heh, it seems you're a good stalker after all... Sorry for the harsh words back then, but you know... You could've just told me about your work for the SBU.
Hi! What are you doing here?
What does it look like? I'm here on business. Selling the finest stuff pripyat has to offer.
Alright, good bye...
No problem. You know, it'd be better for you to go with me to the military camp, it's safer there.
Okay, everything is better than hiking alone through Pripyat.
Let's go then.
I need to finish one case here, go on, I'll get back to you.
I've got to go.
Wait... Here, take it. It's the most reliable gun in the Zone.
Wait a minute, do you no longer need it?
I've had my fair share of adventure here. You will need it more than I, as I'm going back. Garik will take me back to the Jupiter. So yeah, take it, it's useful.
Good luck to you.
Thank you for this excellent weapon.
Not just excellent - the best in the Zone. She's specially modified ... A little heavy, but you won't be running with it. They will run away from you.
Later.
Uh... come on.
Do you know where did Zulus go?
He left. Asked me to guide him through up to the Jupiter, and not far from the factory, we parted ways. He did not say where he was going to go.

Wait a minute. See, I've ran into trouble here... Mercenaries approached me for assistance, to get to Pripyat. I did take the job and a large sum as payment, but on the way I realized, that I might not be getting out alive... Mercs did not let me go more than a step away from them. I managed to escape on Pripyat's outskirts, but they are probably somewhere in the city already. Be careful.
Did you hear anything about the objectives of the mercenaries?

I did, actually. The mercenaries weren't planning on keeping me alive, so they talked freely. In general, they talked about meeting with their client's people, who were supposed to show them some object, the goal of their assignment.
Where will the meeting take place?
Near this place, in the courtyard of the projects.
Thanks for the information.
You talked about mercenaries - did you hear what they were talking about?

I did, actually. The mercenaries weren't planning on keeping me alive, so they talked freely. In general, they talked about meeting with their client's people, who were supposed to show them some object, the goal of their assignment.
Where will the meeting take place?
Near this place, in the courtyard of the projects.
I reached an agreement with the scientists about the suit. You should go to Herman to get it.
Okay... And where are we going?
To Zulus, he's a fighter living near Yanov station.
The stalkers! OK, let's go, you'd better come with me to him. If I appeared there alone, problems might arise, but with you, they won't start shooting immediately.
Which evacuation zone did you go to?
Sorry, can't talk about this subject. Classified information.
Follow me to Zulus.
Okay, I just need to drop by Herman, to pick up the protective suit.
Come.
Yes, I'll go... just let the Blowout pass. Come back later?
How did you get here?

My helicopter crashed through Jupiter factory's roof. I am the sole survivor, who somehow managed to escape from that place. I got to the nearest emergency evacuation Zone, but couldn't find anyone there. Garik found me there, who got me to this here bunker. He's a good man.
To go to Pripyat, I will need a protective suit with a closed-circuit system of breathing.
What are you planning?

According to my orders, I should move to the nearest evacuation zone, but the area is too dangerous a place. I'm a pilot, for God's sake! That's why I'm sitting here, hoping to be picked up after the operation.
I am putting together a squad for a hike in Pripyat. You with me?

Pripyat? You know, I'll go with you, probably. Maybe one of ours survived and is now in Pripyat... An evacuation zone was there, you know? We have orders to head there. I'd not go alone, but with your squad, I'll gladly head out.
Are you ready to go?
I guess that I'm basically ready.
Hello stalker.
Hello.
Good morning.
Hello, Major.
Where did you get a military uniform?
You are probably already aware that military helicopters crashed in the area. I'm Lieutenant Sokolov, co-pilot of one of them.
About the sentry...
His message came from the old supermarket, but he is not responding to our calls. Maybe he lost his radio... I can't say for sure, you need to go and find him.
Thank you, Colonel. I think I'll manage to find him.
About the sentry...

Yes. All happened because of this controller... Probably that's what happened to the recon team, he forced them to shoot each other... This place is just horrible, and the worst thing is, we don't know how to fight it. That psi-mutant was a complete surprise for us... damn, casualties again...
At least this controller is dead now.

I hope it'll be a little safer from now on... I'm grateful for your assistance, Major... I bet you've spent a lot of ammo on that bastard, find lieutenant Kirilov and tell him that you have my permission to restock.
Thank you, Colonel.
Do not worry, Colonel. I'll find this creature.
Can you tell me more about the job?
Who is he?

If we do not immediately find the source of the interference, then we can only wait for death. First larger Monolith attack and we bite the dust fast, and this operation will truly become a complete failure.
I will try to find the source of the interference.
Well Major? Did you find the source of the interference?
Not yet.
Garik told me about his encounter with the mercenaries...

Yes, he told me about it too... When he fled from them, he came here, afraid that they might give pursuit. Fortunately, both for him and for us, they did not follow. Their meeting place is under our surveillance, and so far it's quiet... I wish we knew what they were looking for here...
I have information that the mercenaries are looking for a secret laboratory in Pripyat.
A secret laboratory in Pripyat? ...Where did you get this information?
From a notebook of the mercenaries I found at the Creek. A stalker named Uncle Yar confirmed this.
Hmm ... Do you know anything else?
They want the central laboratory. During my investigation, I was able to pinpoint its location.
If this is true, then, in addition to zombies and fanatics, we have another enemy... We must decide what to do.
I must attend the meeting and, if possible, eliminate the customer's representative. We will then have some time before they locate the laboratory.

Good decision. While we do not know who else knows about the lab, this will ensure that the mercenaries will not get in there. However, this can cause mercenaries to react - then they will pose a real threat. If possible, try to eliminate both targets. I've ordered lieutenant Kirillov to accompany you.
Alright.
Wait, it may be better to choose a different target.
Tell me which factor should be our priority to destroy.
I must eliminate the leader of the mercenaries. Then they will become disorganized and cease to be a problem.

This is a good solution, but the representative is likely to have time to escape. Then he will be able to transmit information about the laboratories to another group, and the mercenaries will still be able to get there. If it'll be possible, try to eliminate both targets. I ordered lieutenant Kirillov to accompany you.
I do not have the time to do it.
From a laptop, which belonged to the leader of the mercenaries at the Creek.
From a story told to me by Uncle Yar, a stalker from the Yanov station.
About the mercenaries ...
Excellent work - both targets were eliminated. Now the mercenaries will stop being a hindrance to us, and less people will be interested in the laboratory. Keep the rifle, it might come in handy.

Good. Without a leader, the mercenaries will not be a hindrance to us. However, their client's people managed to get away and they might come back to get into the lab, so stay alert. Keep the rifle, it might come in handy.

Good. Without a man who knows the location of the laboratory, the mercenaries won't get there. Then again, they are unlikely to leave Pripyat now and they will remain a constant threat to us, so stay alert. Keep the rifle, it might come in handy.

I see, you changed your mind at the last minute. I guess it's also a good solution. Well, it is also a good solution. Without a leader, the mercenaries will not be a hindrance to us. However, their client's people managed to get away and they might come back to get into the lab, so stay alert. Keep the rifle, it might come in handy.

I see, you changed your mind at the last minute. Without a man who knows the location of the laboratory, the mercenaries won't get there. Then again, they are unlikely to leave Pripyat now and they will remain a constant threat to us, so stay alert. Keep the rifle, it might come in handy.

Damn, it went bad for us. Both the mercenary commander and the client's representative made it out alive, and they both know about us. As if the Monolith wasn't enough... On top of that, they know about the laboratory, so it's only a matter of time, before they get inside. Stay alert and keep the rifle, it might come in handy.
Get your men in gear, Colonel. I'm ready.
Good. Cover Strelok, Major. We can take care of ourselves.

Heh. See, you and Strelok are the two most experienced fighters here, when it comes to the Zone. The problem is that I have to rely on Strelok's words when it comes to his experience, while I saw tangible proof of yours. So, I'm relying on you, Major, you're babysitting our stalker. We can't spare anyone else.
Everyone is ready for action. We are waiting for you, Major.
Seems like all of these fuckheads are down. Get down there, grab the gun and let's pull out while we can.
That's reasonable.
I'm ready, let's go.
Good. Fall in, people.
Let's move.
It'll have to wait. I'm reluctant to lose my boys to an emission.

I'm Captain Tarasov. You might be a Major, but for this operation I'm the one in command. Lives of every soldier in our unit depend on our success. Our orders are as follows: take and hold the west wing of the hospital, wait for the Monolith squad to appear, hit them and get out fast, to avoid drawing unnecessary attention.
Clear as ice, sir.
Good. Fall in, people.
Let's move.
It'll have to wait. I'm reluctant to lose my boys to an emission.
Wait Captain, I'm still not ready.
Did you make out anything?
I discovered several sources of the signal. One is somewhere nearby, and if you destroy it, then, quite possibly, we might get in touch with command.
I've determined the coordinates of the source of the interference. This must be a dedicated jammer, a high-frequency, or even microwave, transmitter.
The device that you destroyed was the source of the interference. There are several of these gadgets around I bet, but we still managed to restore our uplink to command.
Tell me about that signal.
The signal comes and goes, but it's getting closer to the base each time.
That's all?
Not quite. This signal comes in on frequencies rarely used for radio communications.
I see.
Take this weapon and ammo, you can get some rest for now. I'll observe the point from a different location and as soon as I get a visual, I'll call you.
Understood.
Good morning. Lieutenant Kirillov at your service, responsible for maintaining our weapons in working condition and our ammunition stockpile.
How's our ammo supply

So far so good, we raided a Monolith store recently. They had ammunition for all types of weapons, some of which are only used in the Zone nowadays. I wonder how could they get so many weapons... There's no way that someone from the border guard could be that corrupt..
Will you be able to fix my weapons?
Easily. I was taught how to repair almost any weapon.
Alright.
Good morning.
What's broken this time around...?
Here it is - the moment of truth. I wonder if we'll get out or not...
I need ammo.

string_table.string: x Don't we all... What type?

string.text: 9x18mm pistol rounds...
Here... What else?
Here, take...
9x19mm pistol rounds...
11.43x23mm pistol rounds...
Shotgun shells...
5.45x39mm assault rifle ammo...
5.56h45 assault rifle ammo...
9x39mm assault rifle ammo...
Sniper rifle rounds...
Machine gun ammo belts...
That's all I can give you for now, Comrade Major. The Colonel ordered me to conserve ammunition.
Okay, forget it.
I need grenades.
Not a problem... Type?
Hand grenades.
Here, take it...
VOG-25 grenade launcher rounds.
M209 grenade launcher rounds.
Forget it for now.
That's all I can give you for now, Comrade Major. The Colonel ordered me to conserve ammunition.
I need medical help.
I'm always ready to help. Now, let's see ...
That's all, you should feel healthy already.
How do you feel, after what happened there?
Every thing's returning back to relative normal... I had a light shock after the kindergarten, but then the blowout began and all...
Good morning.
The main thing is getting to the helicopters.
I need medical supplies.
Now, let's see what do I have... Here, take this.
Sorry, our supplies are limited. I can't give you more supplies.
We picked up your signal.
Yes, I contacted a stalker, the Guide. He told me how to get to this place through the underground tunnels.
Who is this Guide?
A stalker legend. They say that he can get anywhere in the Zone. Your military friends are lucky that they met him on their way to Pripyat... Otherwise they would still be in the woods.
How did you know that the soldiers are here?
From the Guide, he brought Kowalski and his men here.
Alright.
What information do you have for my Government?

Many things... I am sure that this information can be used to destroy the Zone. I thought that I could do it alone... But it turned out to be a little more complicated. Those who caused it all, they controlled nothing... I'll tell you more when we get out of here.
What did you find in the Sarcophagus?
What I found was lies... The Monolith - Wish Granter - is a fraud, a mirage that clouds the mind. And those who stood behind it were hiding in another place.
Do you know who is behind all of this?
Maybe, maybe not... I don't know what to believe already. But anyway, I learned more than they expected me to.
Okay, enough about that.
I will tell you everything I know. My primary concern is that this information reaches the right ears.
During my investigation I found caches that belonged to your group.
I wonder how did you find them... Was there anything useful inside any of them?
Yes, I found three notes.

Thanks... Ghost and Fang were my friends, we were able to pass through the Brain Scorcher and reach the Chernobyl NPP. After we returned from it, we parted ways... I was wounded and remained with the Doctor, in the swamps. I didn't see them afterwards, but as it turned out, they both died not long ago. Fang was killed by the mercenaries, while Ghost died doing a job for the scientists. But in this case, the past... I now know what to do, I cannot let their deaths to be in vain.
Yes, your message to Ghost.

Thanks... Ghost and Fang were my friends, we were able to pass through the Brain Scorcher and reach the Chernobyl NPP. After we returned from it, we parted ways... I was wounded and remained with the Doctor, in the swamps. I didn't see them afterwards, but as it turned out, they both died not long ago. Fang was killed by the mercenaries, while Ghost died doing a job for the scientists.
Yes, a note for you from Fang.

Thanks... Ghost and Fang were my friends, we were able to pass through the Brain Scorcher and reach the Chernobyl NPP. After we returned from it, we parted ways... I was wounded and remained with the Doctor, in the swamps. I didn't see them afterwards, but as it turned out, they both died not long ago. Fang was killed by the mercenaries, while Ghost died doing a job for the scientists.
Yes, your message to Fang.

Thanks... Ghost and Fang were my friends, we were able to pass through the Brain Scorcher and reach the Chernobyl NPP. After we returned from it, we parted ways... I was wounded and remained with the Doctor, in the swamps. I didn't see them afterwards, but as it turned out, they both died not long ago. Fang was killed by the mercenaries, while Ghost died doing a job for the scientists..
Yes, two notes. Yours to Ghost and to Fang.

Thanks... Ghost and Fang were my friends, we were able to pass through the Brain Scorcher and reach the Chernobyl NPP. After we returned from it, we parted ways... I was wounded and remained with the Doctor, in the swamps. I didn't see them afterwards, but as it turned out, they both died not long ago. Fang was killed by the mercenaries, while Ghost died doing a job for the scientists.
Yes, your notes for Ghost and Fang.

Thanks... Ghost and Fang were my friends, we were able to pass through the Brain Scorcher and reach the Chernobyl NPP. After we returned from it, we parted ways... I was wounded and remained with the Doctor, in the swamps. I didn't see them afterwards, but as it turned out, they both died not long ago. Fang was killed by the mercenaries, while Ghost died doing a job for the scientists.
Yes, that's your message to Fang and to you from him.

Thanks... Ghost and Fang were my friends, we were able to pass through the Brain Scorcher and reach the Chernobyl NPP. After we returned from it, we parted ways... I was wounded and remained with the Doctor, in the swamps. I didn't see them afterwards, but as it turned out, they both died not long ago. Fang was killed by the mercenaries, while Ghost died doing a job for the scientists.
Yes, but I don't have them on me.
Now, let's see... Comrade Major, things are bad with your help - only if you want to become an astronaut, hehe.
Come on, Major, do not delay. The Monolith will not wait!

Major, we have suffered a setback, as we lost our sentry. His signal points to the supermarket building, it's not too far away, but he's not answering our calls. Fuck knows what happened there, maybe his psyche finally caved in, twisted after the helicopter crash. Could you check his location?
Consider it done.
I can't promise anything.
Mayor, I need you to locate our recon team.

You will move to object A17, together with the rest of the squad. Captain Tarasov will show you the exact location, it's at the hospital, two wings with a connecting corridor. Monolithans are currently in the eastern wing, so you will set up your ambush in the building across. The weapon will be carried by him - the most insane one.
He's probably the leader of the squad, my men saw him preaching to his troops. Literally preaching. Be careful: hell knows what to expect from the likes of him.
I understand you, Colonel.
Good morning. I am Colonel Kowalski, commander of this unit.
Mayor Degtyarev, SBU. Selected to investigate the failure of Operation Fairway.

All is clear, then. Now, listen to what I say, Major, let's skip the formalities. Fairway was a foolproof plan, we had every base covered! Regardless, I lost more than a half of my men in the helicopter crashes and skirmishes afterwards, not to mention that we've been unable to reach Command. That's... I think you'll believe me when I say that I'd like to know the reasons behind the mission's failure myself!
What's your take on the situation?

My current version is that we were knocked out of the sky by some unknown weapon, similar to the ones Monolith used against us during our first assault on Chernobyl. Generally, I'd like to take a sample of this weapon and study it closely. If you want to take part in this operation: my men tracked down a Monolith squad with this gun in their possession and are ready to seize it at moment's notice. All they need is my signal. Are you interested?
I'm interested, but I have two conditions: I get all the information we gather and I remain independent.
I got the information about that unknown weapon. It was a Gauss Cannon.
Wow... That's some news! How powerful is it? Can it really shoot down a helicopter?
In theory, yes. But such a high velocity bullet would leave holes in the helicopter hulls, but I could find none.

Damn... dead end. I've no more guesses, Major. All that's left now is sitting in this fifth evac zone and waiting - maybe someone will suddenly remember how to fly? Okay, that's enough bullshit for now. We have to solve our current problems. At least we know that lying in cover might not be a good idea - something could punch through and we wouldn't notice! Thank you Major, if we have new information or tasks for you, I will contact you.
In principle, yes. But Stingray-4 and Stingray-5 had completely shielded and armoured electronics, something that even an armour piercing round can't penetrate.
How is the progress of the operation?
Sergeant Morozov was killed. Monolithans sacrificed their own men to lure us into a trap.
Bastards! How could they know about our plan to capture the weapon? Damn, we lost a sniper. What was the result of the operation?
We had casualties. Monolithans sacrificed their own men to lure us into a trap.
Bastards! How could they know about our plan to capture the weapon?! I lost men again... Tell me, what was the result of the operation?
My squad was killed. Monolithans sacrificed their own men to lure us into a trap.
Bastards! How could they know about our plan to capture the weapon?! Now I'm without Tarasov or his men... What was the result of the operation?
I have the weapon, but there's one problem: it was damaged during the fighting.

In other words, we're still at square one and don't know if it can shoot down a helicopter or not... Hmmm... Listen, Major, you seem to have connections with stalkers. Maybe one of them knows how to deal with this kind of stuff? They do deal in technology, after all. Could you talk to them?
Affirmative.
Yes... Yes, yes, yes. By the way: another stalker came from the Jupiter. You can go talk to him, if you want.
I'm working on it.
Alright. Major, we need to figure out this problem. I don't think I have to explain to you just how serious our situation is.
Yes.
I found your note at the Volkhov SAM. Here.
Listen, you... Ah, okay, I think that no one from my squad will appear at that zone. You know, if you suddenly notice soldiers anywhere in the area, tell me, okay? Thanks in advance.
It's you Major, thank God! I'm saved ...
What were you doing there?

Oh... I don't really remember. I do know it was horrible, with much noise all... why... hell, I can't remember! I felt the need to hide, I took off and ran... Street after street, turn after turn, I came back to senses inside of this box. The door was locked and I couldn't open it from the inside. I thought that I was going to die here for sure! How did you find me? ...Ah, it doesn't matter, let's just get the hell out of here, get somewhere closer to the base while I can keep my shaking under control.
Let's go.
Good morning. Do you need medical assistance? I am not a doctor, but I can pull out bullets or sew up wounds. I'm just a self-taught doctor.
I need information.
Ask.
About Operation Fairway...
Yes?
Did anything unusual happen during the flight?

Nothing that could case our birds to fall, no. Everything went smoothly - we took off and activated defences thirty seconds later. The autopilot was functioning correctly, we took the shortest safe path out of those available on our maps. We didn't have poor visibility either: we had a clear view of the surroundings and had a lot of height in reserve. According to the plan, we should have arrived at the station in twelve and a half minutes... But in the ninth minute, we lost communications with Stingray-4 and the others soon followed.
A few questions...
What do you know about the fate of the helicopters?

Little. I don't know anything about Stingray-2 and Stingray-4: their crash sites, crews... I know about the remaining helicopters from survivors and since there's just a handful of them... the full picture is more than just a little blurry.
Tell me about Stingray-1.
How did you get here?

We ran into a stalker, not far from the minefield, he came to investigate the exploding mines. A strange guy, introduced himself as the Guide and proposed to take us to Pripyat. It was consistent with our plans, so I agreed. As a precaution, we held him at gunpoint, but he did not try anything and on the outskirts of the city he just turned around and walked away. I wasn't aware just how crazy the orders were back then.
Tell me about Stingray-3.

According to Captain Tarasov, both engines died first and they had to put the bird down on a hill in the vicinity of point B2. They were lucky, sat down gently. Unfortunately, Lieutenant Kirillov, our technician, did not have time to examine the engines and determine the cause of the malfunction, as a group of Snorks attacked, killing three soldiers. The rest decided to not hang around for much longer, made contact with Stingray-5's crew and moved on. On the way they clashed with a heavily armed squad, but suffered no losses.
How did they get to Pripyat?

Soldiers from Stingray-3 and Stingray-5 regrouped near the crash sites, on a barge. According to them, a complete lunatic lives there, who, when they tried to detain him, told them that he would arrest them, one against eleven. However, they managed to negotiate a deal with this madman, who agreed to lead them all to Pripyat. They had only one major incident on the way - Stetsenko, one of my lieutenants, lost two fingers on his leg to a gravity anomaly, due to pure stupidity...
Tell me about Stingray-5.

Crashed into a swamp with completely fried electronics. Five men survived the crash and managed to rendezvous with Stingray-3's crew. They ran into a bloodsucker near the radar station on the way, who killed their commander, Major Neborsky. He was a good officer... Others managed to survive, although we lost one of them, a sergeant, in a skirmish with the Monolith. Damn snipers...
How did they get to Pripyat?

Soldiers from Stingray-3 and Stingray-5 regrouped near the crash sites, on a barge. According to them, a complete lunatic lives there, who, when they tried to detain him, told them that he would arrest them, one against eleven. However, they managed to negotiate a deal with this madman, who agreed to lead them all to Pripyat. They had only one major incident on the way - Stetsenko, one of my lieutenants, lost two fingers on his leg to a gravity anomaly, due to pure stupidity...

Little. About Stingray-2 - nothing at all, its crash site or the crew. Now, you know much more about Stingray-4 than I do - you found Sokolov, who was the only one to survive the crash. I know about the remaining helicopters from survivors and since there's just a handful of them... the full picture is more than just a little blurry.

Little. About Stingray-2 - nothing at all: its crash site or the crew. Now, you know much more about Stingray-4 than I do - you found Sokolov, who was the only one to survive the crash. I know about the remaining helicopters from survivors and since there's just a handful of them... the full picture is more than just a little blurry.
I need other information.
No more questions.
What is the situation in Pripyat?
Crap, as usual. Pripyat's swarming with Monolith and zombies, while blowouts happen more often than rains! And then there are hordes of mutants and piles of anomalies... We just try to survive.
How's your situation with equipment and supplies?
Tell me about Monolith.

Typical fanatics. We don't really know what do they believe in, we just see how they fight. It doesn't know the meaning of retreat, even when facing far more powerful foes... that is, if we actually manage to gain the advantage, since it's them, who usually have it. They are being constantly reinforced by the Chernobyl NPP, can you imagine? Fucking bastards. There's so few of us left and yet they can always find a few more guys to throw at us...
Did you try to question them?

It's useless, they do not stop and fight until their death, biting as they go down. We once managed to miraculously capture one, deafened by a grenade, but the questioning did not give us anything. It wasn't a pretty sight: when the Monolithan regained consciousness, he immediately sprinted at the wall and splattered his brains all over it.
What are you going to do?

Maintaining a fairway is impossible in my opinion. I think Command thinks so too, since you're here. We'll just hold the fort here, until helicopters arrive - and then... We have several backup evacuation sites at our disposal.
Until we manage to identify what downed the Stingrays, the helicopters won't come.

Well, Major... Listen. We are not getting out from the Zone, not by foot at least. Devil knows how many different charms does the road hold, plus, for stalkers we're like an itch, just begging to be scratched. It all comes down, I suppose, to surviving and getting information. It seems Major that our goals coincide as they never did before.
Not right now.
Yes, Major.

The situation with equipment? We have what we brought with us on our backs since the crash, plus a little of the usual odds and ends we picked up on the way. Our ammunition stocks are enough to keep the Monolith at bay for now. But in general, we are just barely hanging in there. It's the same story with food: we're making it through the day with a little soup, MLEs and grub from a Monolith storehouse we raided.

The situation with equipment? We have what we brought with us on our backs since the crash, plus a little of the usual odds and ends we picked up on the way. Our ammunition stocks are enough to keep the Monolith at bay for now. But in general, we are just barely hanging in there. It's almost the same story with food, but I made a deal with this stalker, Garik,to bring us some canned food. In return, we let him use our safehouse and don't interfere with his artifact hunting... Everyone just wants to survive.
Uh... we avenged our guys. Do what you need to do and let's return to the base. We can't afford to waste any more time here.
Let's not stay here too long, eh? We should head back to the base as soon as possible...
Yeah.

Now that's a weird little think, don't you agree? Hell, what do they need it for? ...I guess it makes no difference for us. Come on, we'll let others scour this place, our job here is done. Let's get back to the base.
Well, is everyone ready? I'd return to the base now: there are mutants here just begging to be hunted down!
Yeah.
How are you holding up?
Kind of meh. No, it's good to be with your own guys again... Only, as it turns out, we're all in deep shit now.
I haven't seen you before, are you a recent arrival?
Yes. I'm Lieutenant Sokolov, co-pilot of Stingray-4.
How did you get here?

I came here with a stalker, Garik's his name. He took me with him when he went to find a way to Pripyat. That was a really tough hike, believe me... Anyway, we ran into military sentries in Pripyat, and, well, here I am.
What happened to Stingray-4?

I do not know. Damn, I really don't know! I had a bad feeling before we took off... In general, we flew on autopilot, the instruments were all checking out and then - wham! - we're crashing down like a stone. Every thing's dead, not even a single light's on on the console! We tried to find some flat ground to land on, but it didn't work - we hit the roof of Jupiter factory's main hall, smashed right through it... I'm the sole survivor...
I need an outfit.

Okay. First, here's the helmet... I hope it holds together. Is it your size? I can swap it for another one, but I can't really give you another. Every one I have had to be patched together and hopefully, they'll withstand a bullet or two.
Of course, Major. Besides, it's not like I have much of a choice in the matter. By the way, talk to Lieutenant Kirillov, he can give you some equipment.
About the helicopters...
Yes...
Oh, for fuck's sake! Kirillov's begging for analgesics again...
Waiting is the worst. Drains your entire spirit, dammit...
Alright Major, my boys are all packed up and ready to go. If you need anything, restock at Rogovtsev and Kirillov. Tell me when you're ready to go.
Affirmative.
Let's move.

Well, then I need a good one, like those the scientists wear. Although I think it might be difficult to persuade Herman into giving me a suit, he had that look on his face, that I should go on foot to the edges of the Zone and stop taking up place at their bunker... Maybe Ozersk will be more sympathetic? He is a bit softer, so maybe... He'll agree to give me a suit.
Well, Major?
[more ...]
[more ...]

I was on board. When we lost contact with Stingray-4, I broadcast information about the evacuation Zone in Pripyat to the remaining crews. I thought we could still make it to the plant, but just moments later, the helicopter shook and we could see fire bursting from the engines. My pilots were able to keep it intact long enough to reach the heliport near the Jupiter factory, but both were killed when we landed, or rather crashed, there. Then we lost Sergeant Shlyachin, who discovered that all access points to the heliport were mined. And another soldier we lost in Pripyat itself, during the battle with Monolith for this here building.
